feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [GLOBAL][Baremetal] - Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer boot mode) removal
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 23, 09:00 - 13:00 UTC

Apr 17, 14:50 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Baremetal offer.

Start time : 23/06/2025 09:00 UTC
End time : 23/06/2025 13:00 UTC
Service impact : The Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer boot mode) will no longer be available after 23/06/2025.
Service improvement : The objective of this maintenance is to remove the Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer boot mode) for all Baremetal products.
Customers should start using the new Debian-12-based rescue system (rescue12-customer).

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [GLOBAL][Virtual Private Servers] - maintenance notification
entry.content:

Apr 16, 20:35 UTC

Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be doing a maintenance on our Virtual Private Servers offer related to this maintenance: https://public-cloud.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/r5bm25kd48bt.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [BHS6][Dedicated Servers] - Rack T06C17 maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 28, 10:00 - 12:00 UTC

Mar 6, 23:13 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Dedicated Servers offer on the specified rack.

This may temporarily affect availability.

Start time : 28/04/2025 10:00 UTC
End time : 28/04/2025 12:00 UTC
Service impact : During the operation, public and vRack network will be temporarily unavailable for servers located in rack T06C17.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be doing a maintenance on a network equipment.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [UK2][Virtual Private Servers] - Workflow Management service maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 22, 14:00 - 15:00 UTC

Apr 16, 20:26 UTC
Scheduled - We want to inform you about an upcoming maintenance window for our Workflow Management service, Mistral.

Here are the details of the maintenance:
Start time : 22/04/2025 14:00 UTC
End time : 22/04/2025 15:00 UTC
Service impact : During this maintenance window for the Workflow Management service (Mistral), you may encounter the following impacts:

Workflows in progress at the start of the maintenance will be stopped and will be restarted automatically after the maintenance is completed. We understand that this may cause a temporary disruption in your workflow processing, and we apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Cron triggers (scheduled workflow executions) during the maintenance period will not be triggered. If you have any workflows scheduled to run during the maintenance window, we recommend rescheduling them to run outside of this timeframe to avoid any disruption.

Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be performing a maintenance on the Mistral service infrastructure. This maintenance is necessary to ensure the continued reliability and performance of our platform.

If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to our support team.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [ERI1][Dedicated Servers] - Rack E102B

Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be migrating servers from rack E102B to rack E101D03.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [GRA1/GRA2/GRA3/GRA4][Dedicated Servers] - IPMI incident notification
entry.content:
Apr 18, 23:49 UTC
Monitoring - We have new information regarding the incident that affected your service(s).

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : IPMI interface is back to nominal state in all regions since 18/04/2025 23:27 UTC.
Ongoing Actions : Our technical teams continue to actively monitor the situation to ensure the service remains stable and to quickly address any potential issues that may arise.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Apr 18, 23:02 UTC
Update - We are currently experiencing an incident affecting our Dedicated Servers offering, which is causing temporary availability issues on IPMI interface in GRA1/GRA2/GRA3/GRA4 region.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 18/04/2025 22:24 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : IPMI interface unavailable in specified region.
Customers Impact : Customers in specified regions may be currently unable to access the IPMI interface to manage their services. Other regions are not impacted by this ongoing issue.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident to fix it. 

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Apr 18, 22:46 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing an incident affecting our Dedicated Servers offer.
Start time : 18/04/2025 22:24 UTC

Our teams are fully committed to investigating this issue and working towards a resolution as soon as possible. As investigations are ongoing, we will share any new findings or updates with you as soon as possible.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

entry.title: [UK2][Virtual Private Servers] - Workflow Management service maintenance notification
entry.content:
Apr 15, 16:57 UTC
Completed - Our teams had to perform a rollback during this maintenance. There was no unplanned impact and all services have been back to normal since 14:54 UTC. A new schedule will be announced in the coming days.

Apr 15, 14:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Apr 9, 06:44 UTC
Scheduled - We want to inform you about an upcoming maintenance window for our Workflow Management service, Mistral.

Here are the details of the maintenance:
Start time : 15/04/2025 14:00 UTC
End time : 15/04/2025 15:00 UTC
Service impact : During this maintenance window for the Workflow Management service (Mistral), you may encounter the following impacts:

Workflows in progress at the start of the maintenance will be stopped and will be restarted automatically after the maintenance is completed. We understand that this may cause a temporary disruption in your workflow processing, and we apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Cron triggers (scheduled workflow executions) during the maintenance period will not be triggered. If you have any workflows scheduled to run during the maintenance window, we recommend rescheduling them to run outside of this timeframe to avoid any disruption.

Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be performing a maintenance on the Mistral service infrastructure. This maintenance is necessary to ensure the continued reliability and performance of our platform.

If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to our support team.

Here are the details of the maintenance:
Start time : 14/04/2025 14:00 UTC
End time : 14/04/2025 15:00 UTC
Service impact : During this maintenance window for the Workflow Management service (Mistral), you may encounter the following impacts:
- Workflows in progress at the start of the maintenance will be stopped and will be restarted automatically after the maintenance is completed. We understand that this may cause a temporary disruption in your workflow processing, and we apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.
- Cron triggers (scheduled workflow executions) during the maintenance period will not be triggered. If you have any workflows scheduled to run during the maintenance window, we recommend rescheduling them to run outside of this timeframe to avoid any disruption.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be performing a maintenance on the Mistral service infrastructure. This maintenance is necessary to ensure the continued reliability and performance of our platform.
If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to our support team.

We appreciate your understanding and cooperation as we work to improve our platform and provide you with the best possible service.
